cheatsheet.title: Generating a project for your data

intro.description: Debrief NG stores it's data in a local folder called a Project. It's into this folder that you place analysis files and links to existing data folders elsewhere on your machine/network.

item.title: Check Navigator is open
item.description: In the top left hand corner of Debrief you should find the Navigator window. If is isn't there, select "Navigator" from Debrief's Window/Show View menu.

item.title: Check you need a project
item.description: If the navigator window is empty, then you need to create a project. If the window already contains a folder-icon then hey, you're ready to go, well done!

item.title: Create a project
item.description: Right-click in the Navigator view, and select 'Project...' from the 'New' sub-menu. The New Project wizard will open.

item.title: Select General project
item.description: From the 'General' folder, select Project, and then press 'Next'

item.title: Name the project
item.description: Now just enter a name for your project (this could be the name of the current exercise)

item.title: Done
item.description: Just press the 'Finish' button, and you will see the new project in your workspace.
